nodes.bodyText: We should probably stop using colors for allowlist/denylist.  Supposedly it's being looked at more and more by open source funders and makes them a bit uncomfortable when reviewing potential projects.  Probably best for us to start being better about this.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -6,9 +6,18 @@ jobs:
   include:
     - dist: trusty # Fastest build first
       jdk: oraclejdk8 # Trusty default
-    - jdk: openjdk11 # Bionic default
-    - jdk: openjdk13
-    - os: osx
+    # Whitelist release branches (e.g. v3.5)so they build on all platforms

nodes.bodyText: Which colors and which allow/deny lists?

nodes.bodyText:
The comment with Whitelist mentioned.
Btw, I've asked CS&S about general concerns on their Slack just so we have some guidance on this from them.  I'm not especially worried because I know human society is slowly changing and becoming "woke" or "aware" of bias in many things.  This is normal, societies improve over time and generally become more caring as they continue to learn from mistakes from the past.
Anyways, let's not get fully unfocused here.  It's just a comment for now, and let's wait to see what CS&S has to say because it will be helpful guidance for all.
